Joi's Oven Roasted Spatchcocked Chicken

Directions

Prepare the day before:

Spatchcock whole chicken and dry brine the day before with salt and pepper. Lift skin on breast and separate and season under the skin as well.

Cooking:

Pre-heat oven to 425ºF - recipes range between 400 and 450ºF.

Sear:

Heat cast iron skillet over medium-high heat and coat with light olive oil. When the oil is hot and shimmering, put chicken on skillet breast side down and sear for 6 to 8 minutes. The skillet idea comes from SFAH.

Oven:

Flip the chicken over and put skillet in oven.

After 20 min or so, rotate the pan 180º. The back of the oven is supposed to be hotter.

Cook for less than 45 min or so until the breast is 145ºF and the legs are 160ºF.

Rest:

Remove from oven and rest for 10-15 min.

Carve and Serve.

Ingredients

Whole Chicken

Salt & Pepper

Light Olive Oil

Notes

Some recipes add tarragon, paprika or thyme and sliced lemon or oregano, thyme, garlic and rosemary.

With a 5.5 lb chicken, at 45 min it was 10 degrees too hot.
